p: Higher costs and limited availability of fish meal and fish oil have led to several evaluations of the effect of their replacement with alternative sustainable sources, such as those derived from terrestrial plants and animals in diets of different fish species. While partial replacement generally was successful in terms of growth performance, full replacement mostly resulted in lower content of Ï‰3 and essential fatty acids, as well as poor growth performance [ 8], [ 9], [ 10], [ 11].
